sen.j: 金森 長光（かなもり ながみつ）は、美濃国上有知藩の第2代（最後）の藩主。
sen.e: Nagamitsu KANAMORI was the second (the last) lord of Kozuchi Domain in Mino Province.
Nagamitsu KANAMORI was the second (and last) lord of Kozuchi Domain in Mino Province.

sen.j: 慶長10年（1605年）、初代藩主・金森長近の次男（82歳の時の子）として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in 1605 as the second son of the first lord of the domain, Nagachika KANAMORI (the child was born when he was 82 years old).
He was born in 1605 as the second son of the first lord of the domain, Nagachika KANAMORI (who was 82 years old at the time).

sen.j: 長兄の金森長則が天正10年（1582年）の本能寺の変で二条城において織田信忠に殉じていたため、金森家の家督と飛騨国の領土は長近の養子・金森可重が継いで、長光は慶長13年（1608年）に長近が死去すると、上有知・関・河内国金田2万3,000石を相続することとなった。
sen.e: Because his eldest brother, Naganori KANAMORI, sacrificed himself for Nobutada ODA by committing suicide in Nijo-jo Castle at the Honnoji Incident in 1582, Arishige KANAMORI, another adopted son of Nagachika, took over as the head of the Kanamori family and inherited the territory of Hida Province, and when Nagachika passed away in 1608, Nagamitsu inherited 23,000 koku in Kozuchi, Seki, and Kaneda in Kawachi Province.

sen.j: しかし慶長16年（1611年）10月6日（異説として8月23日）に夭逝する。
sen.e: However, he passed away on October 6 (heresy August 23) in 1611.

sen.j: 継嗣は無く、上有知藩の金森家は無嗣断絶で改易となったのである。
sen.e: He had no heir, and the Kanamori family of Kozuchi Domain ended due to lack of an heir, and they had to forfeit their properties and the rank of samurai.

sen.j: 家臣の島三安、肥田忠親、池田政長においては、遺領のうちより各1,000石宛がわれ幕府に召しだされた。
sen.e: The vassals, Mitsuyasu SHIMA, Tadachika HIDA and Masanaga IKEDA, were each provided with 1,000 koku from the remaining domain, and they were sent bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
